subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Flashcards
msgSnippet: Sergey: Thanks for your work on flashcards.  Practice is what everybody needs to develop fluency in reading QS.  Your flashcards can help to develop that
messageBody:
Sergey:

Thanks for your work on flashcards.  Practice is what everybody needs to develop fluency in reading QS.  Your flashcards can help to develop that automatic fluency.  I just ran through the alphabet to see how it works.

I can see that using this program with a deck of common words could be very helpful in promoting QS literacy.

By the way, the Thoth font does have No. 20 (whitewheat):  it is mapped to the ~ key.  So you should include it in your flashcard set.

Paige

Sergey Goldgaber wrote:

I've just discovered a pretty nice, free, and full featured open source
flashcard program called Anki - http://ichi2. net/anki/ index.html

I intend to use Anki to create flashcards that can be used to study
Quikscript.

My first set of flashcards is of the Junior Quikscript alphabet displayed
in the Thoth font, and can be found in the Flashcards folder in the files
section of this group:

http://groups. yahoo.com/ group/Read_ Alphabet/ files/Flashcards

As the Thoth font does not have QS character 20 (Whitewheat) , it is not
present in this flashcard set. Also not present are any ligatures, the
characters for X, or abbreviations.

I encourage other members of this group to create and contribute their own
QS flashcard sets.

--Sergey
